children.name: bend b2
children.definition: bend to make sth have acurvedshape, or to fold something at an angle, by pushing or pressing it:uốn
examples: someone had bent the aerial.
he bent the wire into an ‘s’ shape.
bend sth back/down etc
we had to bend the branches back so we could get through the bushes and back onto the path.

children.name: coil x
children.definition: coil towindortwistinto around shape, or to wind or twist sth in this way:cuộn tròn lại, quấn tròn lại
examples: the snake had coiled itself in a corner of the cage.
the snake coiled around the branches of the tree.
he coiled the rope.
coil up[m]
they coiled up the rope and put it away.
her long hair was coiled up in a plait at the top of her head.
—coiledadjective[ only before noun ]

children.name: twist c2
children.definition: twist to bend and turn sthseveraltimes, such as a piece of wire, cloth, or rope, especially in order to tie it to sth or make sth with it:xoắn, cuộn , quấn
examples: laura twisted the handkerchief in her hands nervously.
we twisted a wire coathanger and used it to open the car door.
twist sth into/around/through etc sth
her long blonde hair was twisted into a knot on the back of her head.
she twisted her handkerchief into a knot.
twist sth together
twist the two ends of the wire together.

children.name: bent x
children.definition: bent sth that is bent has lost its original shape and is not flat or straight:cong
examples: ▪ the nail was bent.
▪ how did this spoon get bent?
▪ the hinge was bent and the lid wouldn’t shut properly.
▪ stand with your legs slightly bent.

children.name: wavy x
children.definition: wavy/ˈweɪvi/ a line or edgethat is wavy hassmoothbends in it in aregularpattern:
examples: gợn sóng, uốn lượn ( mềm mại )
▪ a series of wavy lines appeared on the video monitor.
một loạt các đường gợn sóng hiện ra trên màn hình video
▪ the flag’s stripes are wavy and alternate in color.
sọc lá cờ lượn sóng và xen kẽ nhau

children.name: curved x
children.definition: curved/kɜːʳvd/  sth that is curved has a long, smooth bend in it, usually because it has been made that way:
examples: cong ( mềm mại, thường là được làm như vậy )
▪ the knife had a heavy curved blade.
▪ the temple’s roof is curved, in the thai style
▪ an airplane wing is curved on top and flat on the bottom.

children.name: twisted b2
children.definition: twisted/ˈtwɪstɪd, ˈtwɪstəd/  something that is twisted has been bent inmany directionsso that it has lost its original shape and may be impossible to recognize:
examples: quăn queo ( bị uốn cong thành nhiều hướng )
▪ pieces of twisted metal and rusted pipe lay scattered around the yard.
nhiều mảnh kim loại xoắn và ống rỉ rải rác khắp sân
▪ investigators sifted through the twisted wreckage of the plane.
các nhà điều tra đã nhìn qua những đống đổ nát vặn vẹo của chiếc máy bay

children.name: warped x
children.definition: warped/wɔːʳpt/  awoodenobjectthat is warped has bent and twisted because ofheatordryness, so that it isno longer flat or straight:
examples: bị cong ( miếng gỗ phẳng, do bị tác động nhiệt, khô, tuổi thọ )
▪ the window frames on the front of the house were badly warped.
các khung cửa sổ ở phía trước ngôi nhà bị bẻ cong
▪ an old man was sweeping the warped boards of the front porch.
một ông lão đang quét những tấm ván bị bẻ cong ở phía trước nhà

children.name: crooked x
children.definition: crooked/ˈkrʊkɪd, ˈkrʊkəd/  something such asa line, row, pipe, or treethat is crooked is not straight but bendssharplyinoneormoreplaces :
examples: cong queo, khúc khủy ( ở 1 hay nhiều điểm )
▪ smoke rose out of the crooked chimney.
khói bay ra khỏi ống khỏi uốn cong.
▪ they moved down the narrow crooked streets of the old town.
họ đi xuống những con đường cong nhỏ hẹp ở phố cổ

children.name: wiggly x
children.definition: wiggly/ˈwɪgəli/  a wiggly line is one that has a lot of small curves in it :
examples: ngoằn nghoèo , uốn éo, vặn vẹo, cong queo
▪ she wrote with large wiggly letters.

children.name: flexible c2
children.definition: flexible sth that is flexible is able to bend easily or can be bent easily, especially because it has been made like this to do a particular job:mềm dẻo dễ uốn
examples: the better tennis racquets are made out of tough but extremely flexible graphite.
designers have come up with a technique for making skis more flexible.
shoes with flexible rubber soles

children.name: pliable x
children.definition: pliable able to bend withoutbreakingorcracking:mềm dẻo, dễ uốn
examples: high quality leather is firm yet pliable.
a shoe made of soft pliable leather
—pliability[u]

children.name: when a road, river etc bends
weave x
children.definition: weave to turn and change direction, especially around things, in smooth curves: đi quanh co
examples: weave through/up/across etc
the river weaved across the plain, towards the sea.
weave its way
the old highway weaved its way through tucson.

children.name: bend b2
children.definition: bend/bend/  uống cong
examples: ▪ the road bends right then left, before passing a petrol station.
▪ at the top of the hill, the path bends sharply left and enters a small woodland.
bend[c] b2 the place where aroadorriverturns:chỗ uốn khúc, chỗ cong
the taxi went around the bend at an alarming speed.
bend in
the balcony overlooked a wide bend in the river.
round a bend
as we rounded the bend, i could see the town up ahead.

children.name: curve x
children.definition: curve if a road, track, coast etc curves, it has alongsmoothbend in it:uốn cong
examples: curve away/round/towards etc
the dusty white road curved away towards the mountains.
a sandy beach curving gently around the bay.
the road curves to the left as you go up the hill.
curve[c] b2 a place where there is a bend in theroad:chỗ cong
he lost control of the car on a sharp curve.
round a curve
i rounded the curve looking for a place to pull over.

children.name: wind b2
children.definition: wind if a road, track, or river winds, it hasmanysmoothbends and is usuallyverylong:uốn khúc quanh co
examples: wind through/along/around etc
the trail winds through the hills and then down towards ironhorse falls.
route 101 winds along the coastline for several hundred miles.
wind its way
we decided to take the blueridge parkway, which winds its way through the smoky mountains.
winding[attri] b2 a winding road, river etc islongand hasa lot of bendsin it: quanh co, ngoằn ngoèo
the car climbed the winding road up into the hills.
a quiet little town on the banks of a peaceful, winding river.

children.name: zigzag x
children.definition: zigzag/ˈzɪgzæg/  if a road, track, or path zigzags it hasmanysharpbendsgoing inoppositedirections:khúc khủy ( với nhiều đường cong rất cứng nhắc)
examples: ▪ the path zigzagged from side to side through the steep gully.
▪ ski routes zigzagging down the mountainside

children.name: twist c2
children.definition: twist if a track, road, or stream twists it has many sharp bends and changes direction many times: cong queo,quanh co, uốn khúc
examples: twist around/along/through etc:
the path twisted back and forth up the side of the mountain:
a dry stream bed twisted through thick tree roots.
twist and turn
the streets are narrow and twist and turn and it is not advisable to take a car up them.
twist its way
we approached assisi via the dusty road that twists its way up monte subasio.
twisting[attri]
wild flowers grew on either side of the twisting path.

children.name: tortuous x
children.definition: tortuous a tortuous path, stream, road etchas a lot ofbendsin so that it is verydifficultto travel along:quanh co, hiểm trở ( do có nhiều khúc cua )
examples: ▪ most of the villages are accessible only by boat or along tortuous jungle trails.
▪ a twisting, tortuous track through the snake mountains

children.name: bend b2
children.definition: bend/bend/ uốn cong
examples: the branches of the tree bent over into the water.
i tried opening it with the knife but the blade bent.

children.name: curl x
children.definition: curl if aleaforpieceofclothcurls, itgraduallybends, starting at its edges, especially as a result ofheatordryness:quăn , cuộn lại
examples: ▪ i threw the letter into the fire. it curled, darkened, and then burst into flames.
curl inwardcuộn lại vào trong
▪ the document was yellow and its edges had curled inward.

children.name: buckle x
children.definition: buckle/ˈbʌkəl/  if sthstrongandhardbuckles, it bends in the middle, usually because of very strongpressureorgreatheat:cong lại, co lại
examples: ▪ the aluminium chair buckled under charles’s weight.
▪ windows shattered with the heat from the blaze and metal doors buckled like cardboard.

children.name: warp x
children.definition: warp if sth made ofwoodwarps, it bends and twists slightly as a result of too muchheat,dryness,ageetc, so that it isno longer flat or straight:cong, vênh
examples: the wooden fence had warped in the hot sun.
to prevent the violin body from warping, there is a strong wooden brace along its whole length.

children.name: stiff b2
children.definition: stiff asubstancesuch asclothorpaperthat is stiff is hard and is difficult to bend: khô cứng
examples: the leaves of the plant are very stiff.
a stiff piece of cardboard.
frozen stiff
in the extreme cold my wet shoes became frozen stiff.

children.name: rigid c2
children.definition: rigid anobjectorstructurethat is rigid is strong and willnotbendorchangeitsshape:cứng
examples: the framework of the aircraft must be rigid yet light.
about a dozen large rigid plates make up the earth’s crust.

children.name: bend b2
children.definition: bend a curved part of something, especially a road or river :
examples: the car came round the bend at a terrifying speed.
bend in
a sharp bend in the road
a sharp/tight bend(= a curve that changes direction suddenly )that road sign means you are approaching a sharp bend.
a hairpin bend(= a very sharp bend in which a road changes direction, usually on a mountain )the road wound up the mountain in a series of hairpin bends.
a slight/gentle/wide bend(= that changes direction slightly or gradually )ahead of us there was a wide bend in the river.
a blind bend(= that you cannot see around when you are driving )never overtake another car on a blind bend.
a left-hand/right-hand bend(= going towards the left or the right )take the turning just after the left-hand bend in the road.
come around/round the bendsuddenly a motorbike came around the bend at top speed.
round the bendhe rounded the bend much too fast.

children.name: curve b2
children.definition: curve along smoothbend in a surface, line, or object:đường cong, khúc uốn cong
examples: from the balcony, you could see the long curve of the shoreline.
morgan was killed when he lost control of his car in a curve.
a smooth curvehe drew a line on the paper in a smooth curve.
a gentle curve(= one that turns gradually in another direction )the river's gentle curves
a sharp/tight curve(= one that turns suddenly in another direction )there's a tight curve in the road up ahead.
an upward/downward curveshe stood watching the upward curve of the bird's flight.
a sweeping curve(= wide and gentle )the sweeping curve of the bay
a graceful curveher arm arched over her head in a graceful curve.

children.name: twist x
children.definition: twist asuddensharpbend in sth: khúc cua, đoạn bẻ cong.
examples: the path has a lot of twists and turns.

children.name: kink x
children.definition: kink asmallsharpbend in sth, especially something that isstraightfor the rest of its length:chỗ bị gập ( trên một đường thẳng dài )
examples: kink in
the water hose had a kink in it.
if there’s a kink in the hose, you won’t get any water.
there was a kink in the path just before the bridge.

children.name: arch c2
children.definition: arch to form or make sth form the shape of an arch
examples: two rows of trees arched over the driveway.
trees archoverthe river.
her eyebrows arched in contempt.
she watched the cat arch itsback.
the dogarcheditsback.

children.name: round a2
children.definition: roundpreposition,adverbmainly uk(us usuallyaround)aroundquanh, vòng quanh, loanh quanh; xung quanh, tròn
examples: in a circular direction or position; around
_the moon goes round the earth.
_we ran round (the outside of the house) to the back, looking for the dog.
_the idea has been going roundand roundin my head all day (= i can't stop thinking about it).
_when one engine stopped, we had toturnround (= turn to face the opposite direction) and fly home.

children.name: roll b1
children.definition: rollverbturn overcuốn, quấn, cuộn
examples: [ t usually + adverb or preposition]
to (cause something to) turn over onto itself to form a cylinder or a sphere
_he rolled the clayintoa ball in his hands.
_as i got closer, the hedgehog rolled itself(up) intoa ball.

children.name: wind b2
children.definition: windverbwound,woundwrap around
examples: to wrap something around an object several times or twist it repeatedly around itself
_she wound a scarfaroundher neck.
_he wound the stringintoa ball.
_he wound a small bandageroundher finger.
